p: Loss-of-function mutations in Parkin ( PARK2, PRKN), PTEN-induced putative kinase 1 ( PINK1), and Daisuke-Junko-1 ( DJ-1) cause rare forms of autosomal recessive Parkinsonism with early onset and slow progression [ 29– 31]. Recessively inherited forms of atypical Parkinsonism with juvenile onset are caused by mutations in the ATPase type 13A2 ( ATP13A2), phospholipase A2 group VI ( PLA2G6), and F-box only protein 7 ( FBXO7) genes [ 32– 34].
